body_content.explanation: a tightly stretched wire or rope fixed high above the ground, which someone walks across as an entertainment:
examples: He learned trapeze moves when he was just a child, and soon was able to walk the high wire.
The Aguilar brothers perform 25 feet above the arena on the high wire.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to a situation that involves a lot of risk:
examples: Many people confidently walk the financial high wire of life without a safety net.
The business has been on a high wire for the past few months.
